intro: Trachydium obtusiusculum var. strictum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trachydium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
